title: Value Functions and Q-Learning
description: From Bellman's recursive insight to teaching machines to learn optimal behavior through trial and error.

notebooks.title: Value Functions: Teaching Machines to Evaluate Positions
notebooks.objective: Implement state value functions and action value functions from scratch, visualize value landscapes on grid worlds, and understand how policies shape values.

notebooks.title: The Bellman Equation: Breaking the Future into One Step at a Time
notebooks.objective: Derive and implement the Bellman equation for V and Q, solve the Bellman optimality equation, and implement value iteration from scratch.

notebooks.title: Q-Learning from Scratch: Learning Without a Map
notebooks.objective: Implement Q-Learning from scratch, train an agent on FrozenLake, understand epsilon-greedy exploration, and compare exploration strategies.

notebooks.title: From Q-Tables to Neural Networks: The Path to Deep Q-Learning
notebooks.objective: Build a DQN agent with experience replay and target networks to solve CartPole, bridging tabular Q-learning to deep RL.

caseStudy.title: Q-Learning for Battery Storage Optimization in Energy Markets
caseStudy.subtitle: Volterra Energy Solutions -- Optimizing Grid-Scale Battery Dispatch with Reinforcement Learning
caseStudy.description: Volterra operates 14 grid-scale battery systems for energy arbitrage. Their rule-based dispatch captured only 44% of theoretical maximum revenue. A tabular Q-Learning agent learned to time charge/discharge cycles to electricity price patterns, improving revenue by 43% and reducing battery degradation.

curator.name: Dr. Rajat Dandekar
curator.title: Course Instructor
curator.bio: Dr. Rajat Dandekar is a researcher and educator specializing in AI/ML, with a passion for making complex concepts accessible through intuitive explanations and hands-on learning.
